c74object.name: bach.poltocar
c74object.digest: Polar to cartesian coordinate conversion for lllls
c74object.description: Converts two lllls consisting of amplitudes (radii) and angle values (in radians) into two cartesian-coordinate lllls consisting of real and imaginary values.

outlet.digest: The real parts or X coordinates
The imaginary parts or Y coordinates

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs the conversion on the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Set amplitudes or phases, output result
method.description:
In the first inlet, an llll sets the amplitudes (radii), and output the converted cartesian coordinates.
In the second inlet, an llll sets the phases (in radians).
As for bach.expr with the scalarmode attribute set to 1, the module automatically iterates lists against single elements

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion: Incoming lllls must be equally structured in order for the result to be consistent
